docs.text: CRIPT Excel Uploader ¶ Usage ¶ Please use the latest release assets Follow these steps ¶ Login or Signup for the CRIPT platform Create an Access Group inside of the CRIPT platform An Access Group serves as permission control for the project. It represents an organization, institution, research group, or any grouping of users. An Access Group is needed because every Project must be owned by an Access Group Create a Project inside the CRIPT platform A Project can be thought of as a bunch of folders each containing experiments that contribute to a single project Essentially some Collections put in one bucket A Project is needed because each Collection belongs to a Project Create a Collection inside the CRIPT platform A Collection can be thought of as a binder filled with experiments The entire Excel file will become a collection within the CRIPT Platform Download example_template_vX-X-X.xlsx from the latest release The example_template_vX-X-X.xlsx can be used by users to directly record their data in the file Additionally, example_template_vX-X-X.xlsx can serve as an example excel file for users to get an idea on how to structure the excel files they may already have to conform with CRIPT Download config.yaml from the latest release Fill out template with your information Download cript_uploader_vX.X.X from latest release Be sure all 3 files in the same directory example_template_vX-X-X.xlsx config.yaml cript_uploader_vx.x.x Input your data into the excel sheet Please refer to filling out row 1 - 3 in the documentation, and also the specifications of individual sheets Run CRIPT Excel Uploader FAQ ¶ What happens if I run the uploader more than once? If the name of an object has not been changed, the existing object will be updated in the database. If the name has been changed, a new object will be created and the old will remain. I entered a number into a cell but the uploader says the value is a string. What gives? This is likely caused by the wrong value type being set for the given cell in the Excel document. What units can I use? Here is a list of the supported units from the Pint Python package. What if I have multiple measurements of the same thing? You can use an ID field in front of row 2 to separate out the different measurements
docs.title: Home

docs.text: Please use the latest release assets
docs.title: Usage

docs.text: Login or Signup for the CRIPT platform Create an Access Group inside of the CRIPT platform An Access Group serves as permission control for the project. It represents an organization, institution, research group, or any grouping of users. An Access Group is needed because every Project must be owned by an Access Group Create a Project inside the CRIPT platform A Project can be thought of as a bunch of folders each containing experiments that contribute to a single project Essentially some Collections put in one bucket A Project is needed because each Collection belongs to a Project Create a Collection inside the CRIPT platform A Collection can be thought of as a binder filled with experiments The entire Excel file will become a collection within the CRIPT Platform Download example_template_vX-X-X.xlsx from the latest release The example_template_vX-X-X.xlsx can be used by users to directly record their data in the file Additionally, example_template_vX-X-X.xlsx can serve as an example excel file for users to get an idea on how to structure the excel files they may already have to conform with CRIPT Download config.yaml from the latest release Fill out template with your information Download cript_uploader_vX.X.X from latest release Be sure all 3 files in the same directory example_template_vX-X-X.xlsx config.yaml cript_uploader_vx.x.x Input your data into the excel sheet Please refer to filling out row 1 - 3 in the documentation, and also the specifications of individual sheets Run CRIPT Excel Uploader
docs.title: Follow these steps

docs.text: What happens if I run the uploader more than once? If the name of an object has not been changed, the existing object will be updated in the database. If the name has been changed, a new object will be created and the old will remain. I entered a number into a cell but the uploader says the value is a string. What gives? This is likely caused by the wrong value type being set for the given cell in the Excel document. What units can I use? Here is a list of the supported units from the Pint Python package. What if I have multiple measurements of the same thing? You can use an ID field in front of row 2 to separate out the different measurements
docs.title: FAQ

docs.text: Excel Rows ¶ Row 1 Row 2 Row 3 ¶ The Row 1 - 3 within each Excel sheet are treated differently than Rows 4 - ∞. Row 1 : Describes the abstract category of Row 2 It can be thought of as an abstraction of row 2 List of possible options for Row 1 ¶ attribute Column with simple key-value pairs condition Column with key, value, and unit combinations for The condition under which the property was discerned identifier Column with key-value pairs for material identifiers property Column with key, value, and unit combinations for properties relation Column that reference other sheets in the template quantity Column with key, value and unit combinations for quantities Relation is a bit tricky to explain, so we dedicated a section that explains row 1 abstract category of relation Row 2 : This is the label for each column Eg. name , density , bigsmiles Each label for each sheet column from a controlled list of vocabulary options from CRIPT Each list of controlled vocabulary options will be listed as a link in the Individual Sheets page Row 3 : Defines the units for that column celsius , g/ml All the supported units are documented relation field in row 1 explained ¶ The row 1 field relation is essentially a way for a row from one sheet to reference another row in a different sheet. In computer science terms, we could think of it as a foreign key type of relationship from the relation row of one sheet to the *name row of another sheet, the name field works well as an identifier because we are requiring names to be unique within a given sheet. row 2 ¶ row 2 Column Field Names ¶ Columns beginning with * are required (eg. *name ) Columns beginning with # will be ignored (eg. #storage ) # columns are a good idea to use if you want to have some notes, but don't want it necessarily read or uploaded to CRIPT Individual Excel Sheets page has a valid values for each sheet's row 2 Nesting Headers for each column in row 2 ¶ We can have more than one field present on a column header if needed We can indicate that we are recording the density at a certain temperature by using a colon ":" and notating it like this: "density:temperature" Examples Define a material property method: density:method Associate data with a process condition temperature:data Associate a citation with a material property: density:citation Define material property condition: density:temperature Define the uncertainty of a material property condition: density:temperature:uncertainty <field>:data column values should derive from the *name column of the Data sheet. <field>:citation column values should derive from the *name column of the Citation sheet. Id - (optional) ¶ Id is used to allow for multiple measurements throughout time. With Id it is possible to take several measurements through an experiment, and later use nesting to record more details. If there are multiple densities throughout time, and we want to show each of their temperatures (or any other condition) we can use an Id field to differentiate between the different temperatures. We denote an Id with brackets and a number inside such as [1] or [2]. The Id is used to identify distinct properties/conditions of the same type e.g., To identify two density measurements at two different temperatures, we could create the following column headers: [1]density , [1]density:temperature , [2]density , [2]density:temperature property property:condition property property:condition [1]density [1]density:temperature [2]density [2]density:temperature g/ml degC g/ml degC 0.87 20 1 30 Row 4 - ∞ ¶ Inputting list instead of a single value ¶ List values must use a semicolon ; as a separator Example: category field name units funder 1; funder 2; funder 3; funder 4
docs.title: Excel Sheets Rows

docs.text: The Row 1 - 3 within each Excel sheet are treated differently than Rows 4 - ∞. Row 1 : Describes the abstract category of Row 2 It can be thought of as an abstraction of row 2
docs.title: Row 1 Row 2 Row 3

If there are multiple densities throughout time, and we want to show each of their temperatures (or any other condition) we can use an Id field to differentiate between the different temperatures. We denote an Id with brackets and a number inside such as [1] or [2]. The Id is used to identify distinct properties/conditions of the same type e.g., To identify two density measurements at two different temperatures, we could create the following column headers: [1]density , [1]density:temperature , [2]density , [2]density:temperature property property:condition property property:condition [1]density [1]density:temperature [2]density [2]density:temperature g/ml degC g/ml degC 0.87 20 1 30

docs.text: How to fill out config.yaml ¶ Host ¶ Host indicates to our program where to host the data from the Excel file, whether that is CRIPT or a private instance For most users host will be criptapp.org host : criptapp.org However, if any user wants to connect to their own private instance of cript, they can easily do that by changing the host to whatever URL they are using Private Instance Example: host : myPrivateWebsite.com Token ¶ The token is needed because we need to authenticate the user before saving any of their data Account Settings under the profile icon dropdown To get your token: please visit your Account Settings under the profile icon dropdown on the top right Then click on "Show API Token" near the bottom to reveal your API token Please click on the copy button to copy your API Token to clipboard Now you can paste it into the token section of config.yaml The "Token" in front of the random characters is part of the token as well Example: token : Token 4abc478b25e30766652f76103b978349c4c4b214 Project ¶ Project is needed for the software to know which project these experiments are for, and each Collection belongs to a Project A Project can be thought of as a bunch of folders each containing experiments that contribute to a single project projects tab within CRIPT To get project name, follow these steps: Navigate to the projects tab within CRIPT Find the project you want to upload your data under Copy the name and paste it into config.yaml Example: project : CRIPT Examples Collection ¶ A Collection can be thought of as a binder filled with experiments The entire Excel file will become a collection within the CRIPT Platform Collections tab within CRIPT To get your collection name, follow these steps: Please visit the collections tab within CRIPT Find the collection you want to use copy the name of that collection and paste it into the config.yaml file Example: collection : Tutorial Path ¶ Please indicate the path where the executable file is located Please note the path may look different depending on the operating system whether the computer is running Windows, Mac, or Linux Example: path : C:\Users\myUsername\OneDrive\Desktop\MIT\cript-excel-uploader Public ¶ This option indicates to our software whether we want to keep the uploaded data private or public This takes a boolean value of either True or False We can indicate True, if we want the uploaded data be publicly available public : True We can indicate False, if we want the uploaded data be private, and hidden from the public public : False
docs.title: Filling Out Config

docs.text: Host indicates to our program where to host the data from the Excel file, whether that is CRIPT or a private instance For most users host will be criptapp.org host : criptapp.org However, if any user wants to connect to their own private instance of cript, they can easily do that by changing the host to whatever URL they are using Private Instance Example: host : myPrivateWebsite.com
docs.title: Host

docs.text: The token is needed because we need to authenticate the user before saving any of their data Account Settings under the profile icon dropdown To get your token: please visit your Account Settings under the profile icon dropdown on the top right Then click on "Show API Token" near the bottom to reveal your API token Please click on the copy button to copy your API Token to clipboard Now you can paste it into the token section of config.yaml The "Token" in front of the random characters is part of the token as well Example: token : Token 4abc478b25e30766652f76103b978349c4c4b214
docs.title: Token

docs.text: Project is needed for the software to know which project these experiments are for, and each Collection belongs to a Project A Project can be thought of as a bunch of folders each containing experiments that contribute to a single project projects tab within CRIPT To get project name, follow these steps: Navigate to the projects tab within CRIPT Find the project you want to upload your data under Copy the name and paste it into config.yaml Example: project : CRIPT Examples
docs.title: Project

docs.text: A Collection can be thought of as a binder filled with experiments The entire Excel file will become a collection within the CRIPT Platform Collections tab within CRIPT To get your collection name, follow these steps: Please visit the collections tab within CRIPT Find the collection you want to use copy the name of that collection and paste it into the config.yaml file Example: collection : Tutorial
docs.title: Collection

docs.text: Please indicate the path where the executable file is located Please note the path may look different depending on the operating system whether the computer is running Windows, Mac, or Linux Example: path : C:\Users\myUsername\OneDrive\Desktop\MIT\cript-excel-uploader
docs.title: Path

docs.text: This option indicates to our software whether we want to keep the uploaded data private or public This takes a boolean value of either True or False We can indicate True, if we want the uploaded data be publicly available public : True We can indicate False, if we want the uploaded data be private, and hidden from the public public : False
docs.title: Public

docs.text: Running CRIPT Excel Uploader ¶ Using the executable ¶ Windows Download cript_uploader_vX-X-X.exe from the latest release Be sure config.yaml, Excel file, and cript_uploader_vX-X-X.exe file are all in the same directory Double-click on cript_uploader_vX-X-X.exe to run the program Mac or Linux Download cript_uploader_vX-X-X from the latest release Open a terminal and navigate the relevant folder bash cd <path_to_folder> Change the file permissions chmod 755 ./cript_uploader Run it ./cript_uploader_vX-X-X Alternatively, you can run the Python Script Directly ¶ Basic Setup: Download Python(>=3.10) Download Git Open a terminal Install virtualenv pip install virtualenv Create a virtual environment python3 -m virtualenv ./cript-uploader Activate the virtual environment Windows : cript-uploader \S cripts \a ctivate Mac or Linux : source cript-uploader \b in \a ctivate Clone the repository git clone git@github.com:C-Accel-CRIPT/cript-excel-uploader.git Change to the project directory cd cript-excel-uploader Download requirements pip install -r requirements.txt Run the main.py file python main.py
docs.title: How to Run Excel Uploader

docs.text: Windows Download cript_uploader_vX-X-X.exe from the latest release Be sure config.yaml, Excel file, and cript_uploader_vX-X-X.exe file are all in the same directory Double-click on cript_uploader_vX-X-X.exe to run the program Mac or Linux Download cript_uploader_vX-X-X from the latest release Open a terminal and navigate the relevant folder bash cd <path_to_folder> Change the file permissions chmod 755 ./cript_uploader Run it ./cript_uploader_vX-X-X
docs.title: Using the executable

docs.text: Basic Setup: Download Python(>=3.10) Download Git Open a terminal Install virtualenv pip install virtualenv Create a virtual environment python3 -m virtualenv ./cript-uploader Activate the virtual environment Windows : cript-uploader \S cripts \a ctivate Mac or Linux : source cript-uploader \b in \a ctivate Clone the repository git clone git@github.com:C-Accel-CRIPT/cript-excel-uploader.git Change to the project directory cd cript-excel-uploader Download requirements pip install -r requirements.txt Run the main.py file python main.py
docs.title: Alternatively, you can run the Python Script Directly

docs.text: Customizing the Excel Sheets ¶ Required sheets are colored Orange Optional sheets are colored Grey Sheets CANNOT be renamed , but sheets CAN be removed The general structure for all sheets ¶ abstract category field name units Your values Sheets ¶ material sheet ¶ Define all materials that will be referenced throughout the document. Row 2 Row 1 Required Expected Value *name attribute yes unique string any identifier key identifier no refer to key table any material property key property no refer to key table notes attribute no string options for each row are clickable links in the chart below: supported abstract categories supported column field names supported units Your values recorded mixture component sheet (optional) ¶ This sheet Defines the components of mixture materials. Before recording any mixtures, the components and materials must be first defined in materials sheet. Row 1 is always relation and Row 2 is always mixture and material Row 1 is always relation , because each column of the mixture sheet MUST reference the material sheet Row 2 Row 1 Required Expected Value *mixture relation yes value from *name column of material sheet *material relation yes value from *name column of material sheet relation relation *mixture (Required) *material (Required) value comes from *name of mixture sheet value from *name of materials sheet experiment sheet ¶ This sheet defines the experiment Row 2 Row 1 Required Value Type *name attribute yes unique value funding attribute no list of values (e.g, str1; str2; str3 ) notes attribute no string If there are multiple sources for funding please list them and separate each one with a ";" (e.g, Grants; NSF; IRIS ) attribute attribute attribute *name (Required) notes (optional) funding (optional) unique experiment name These are my notes funder 1; funder 2; funder 3; funder 4; process sheet ¶ Define the processes of each experiment. Row 2 Row 1 Required Expected Value *experiment relation yes string from *name column of experiment sheet *name attribute yes unique string *type attribute yes any process type keywords attribute no list of keywords (e.g, str1; str2; str3 ) description attribute no string equipment attribute no list of equipment (e.g, str1; str2; str3 ) any process property key property no refer to key table any condition key condition no refer to key table notes attribute no string relation attribute attribute attribute property condition condition *experiment (Required) *name (Required) *type (Required) keywords (optional) process property (optional) any condition value (optional) any condition value (optional) units units value from *name column of experiment sheet pick a unique process name NSF; MIT; NASA; Dow; Pepsi my keywords to find my process description of my process 100.0 55.26 Example: relation attribute attribute attribute attribute condition condition *experiment (Required) *name (Required) *type (Required) keywords (optional) description (optional) temperature (optional) time_duration (optional) degC min value from *name column of experiment sheet pick a unique process name NSF; MIT; NASA; Dow; Pepsi my keywords to find my process description of my process 100.0 55.26 process equipment sheet (optional) ¶ Define the equipment used in a process. Row 2 Row 1 Required Expected Value *process relation yes value from *name column of process sheet *equipment key attribute yes any equipment key description attribute no string any condition key condition no refer to key table *citation relation yes value from *name column of citation sheet relation attribute attribute condition relation *process (Required) *select equipment (Required) description (optional) condition (optional) citation (optional) supported units value from *name column of process sheet equipment used in process description of the equipment value/description of condition value from *name column of citation sheet prerequisite process sheet (optional) Define the immediate prerequisites for each process. e.g., Assuming A -> B -> C , the immediate prerequisite of C is B (not A ). Row 2 Row 1 Required Value Type *process relation yes string from *name column of process sheet *prerequisite relation yes string from *name column of process sheet relation relation *process (Required) *prerequisite (Required) value from *name of process sheet value from *name of process sheet immediate prerequisite step process ingredient sheet ¶ Defines the ingredients used in the process Define the ingredients for each process and their respective quantities. Row 2 Row 1 Required Value Type *process relation yes value from *name column of process sheet *material relation yes value from *name column of material sheet *keyword attribute yes any ingredient keyword any quantity key quantity yes refer to key table relation relation attribute quantity quantity quantity *process (Required) *material (Required) *keyword (Required) quantity value (optional) quantity value (optional) quantity value (optional) ml g mole value comes from *name column of the process sheet value comes from *name column of the materials sheet my keyword to find this ingredient 5 0.455 10 process product sheet ¶ This sheet describes the resulting product after completing a process Define the material products of each process. Row 2 Row 1 Required Value Type *process relation yes string from *name column of process sheet *material relation yes string from *name column of material sheet relation relation *process (Required) *material (Required) value comes from *name column of the process sheet value comes from *name column of the materials sheet data sheet ¶ This sheet defines the data files you want to upload to CRIPT, such as a csv file from a robot, an image, or any other type of file Define the data sets you will be associating with properties, etc. Row 2 Row 1 Required Value Type *experiment relation yes string from *name column of experiment sheet *name attribute yes unique string *type attribute yes any data type sample_prep attribute no string citation relation no string from *name column of citation sheet notes attribute no string relation attribute attribute attribute *experiment (Required) *name (Required) *type (Required) *source (optional) value from *name column of experiment sheet Pick a unique name My type Can be either local: C:\Users\myUsername\Desktop\MIT\cript-excel-uploader\example_template_v0-3-1.xlsx Or on the web: https://google.com citation sheet ¶ This sheet can be used to reference any sources used in the experiments that you want to cite in CRIPT Row 1: can only be an attribute Row 2: MUST have a title column, but ALL other columns are optional Row 3: This row is left blank Define references to be associated with properties, etc. as citations. Row 2 Row 1 Required Value Type *title attribute yes unique string doi attribute no string authors attribute no string journal attribute no string publisher attribute no string year attribute no attribute volume attribute no string issue attribute no string pages attribute no string issn attribute no string arxiv_id attribute no string pmid attribute no string website attribute no string notes attribute no string attribute attribute attribute attribute attribute attribute attribute attribute attribute attribute attribute attribute attribute attribute *title (*Required) doi (optional) authors (optional) journal (optional) publisher (optional) year (optional) volume (optional) issue (optional) pages (optional) issn (optional) arxiv_id (optional) pmid (optional) website (optional) notes (optional) Each title must be unique your doi here Author Here Journal name publisher name year published volume number issue pages issn arxiv_id pmid https://www.example.com These are my notes
docs.title: Individual Excel Sheets
